I

init() - Method in class simpleUIApp.AIPlayer
init actually initializes the AIPlayers attributes AITargets and AIPlanets, AITargets = possible targets for AI (can shoot its own planet), AIPlanets= planets owned by AI, putting ennemies/neutral planets twice in AITargets, just so the AI doesn't shoot at its own planets too much
init(int, int) - Method in class simpleUIApp.Squadron
init() is a recursive function creating the ships necessary, and put some to wait if several waves of ships has to be sent.
intersects(Shape, I) - Method in interface fr.ubordeaux.simpleUI.ItemManager
Returns if a given item intersect with a given selection.
isContained(Shape, I) - Method in interface fr.ubordeaux.simpleUI.ItemManager
Returns if a given item is contained into a given selection.
isGameOver() - Method in class simpleUIApp.SaveGame
 
isHuman() - Method in class simpleUIApp.AIPlayer
 
isHuman() - Method in class simpleUIApp.HumanPlayer
 
isHuman() - Method in interface simpleUIApp.Player
checks whether a player is a HumanPlayer
isLoser() - Method in class simpleUIApp.AIPlayer
isLoser tests whether AI has lost the game
isNeutral() - Method in class simpleUIApp.AIPlayer
 
isNeutral() - Method in class simpleUIApp.HumanPlayer
 
isNeutral() - Method in interface simpleUIApp.Player
checks whether a player is neutral (only used for the neutral planets at the beginning)
ItemManager<I> - Interface in fr.ubordeaux.simpleUI
Any class implementing the interface ItemManager should provide for any instance of type I the implementation of four methods that any item that should be handled by the Arena have to defined.
